page.title: 19FOLK CUSTOMS
page.content: Every two years a carnival is held in Cawthorne.First,all the parents meet and decide on the theme.It is television programmes this year.Each street dresses the children in costumes to match the float.Wood,wire and paint is bought and building begins.The Friday before the carnival,the lorries arrive in the village.Everyone is busy hammering the scenes on the float and finishing the painting.The children start getting excited.At 1.30p.m. on Saturday,all the floats line up.The bands play and the floats,carrying the children,drive to the Village Green,where the judging takes place,then on to the field behind the Village Hall.There we have games and side shows.Cristopher Moisley,aged 9.
